data.event: Hamilton County was formed on October 25, 1819 from portions of Rhea County and Indian land.
In May 1861, Cravens contracted with the Tennessee Military and Financial Board to deliver 20,000 pounds of saltpeter.
In 1862 he quit mining at Lookout Mountain Cave and rented the cave to the Confederate Nitre and Mining Bureau, which mined the cave from June 1862 through July 1863.

event.title: was occupied by Federal forces in 1863

data.event: Mining ceased when Chattanooga was occupied by Federal forces in 1863.
